revised_title: Antigenicity of Myosin and C-Protein in Muscle Structure
tldr: The authors studied the antigenicity of myosin and C-protein in muscle structure. They found that myosin and C-protein are antigenically distinct, meaning C-protein is not derived from myosin. The study also showed that purified myosin can behave as a classically simple antigen, while C-protein is a powerful immunogen. This information is important for understanding the location of these proteins within muscle fibers and for developing antibodies to study muscle structure.
